comment: Yo she changed the game. there's tons of assignments, quizzes and exams all with lockdown. ughhhh

Dr. Simon is the best Lab professor I have ever had as a BIO major. She clearly loves to teach. She is funny, sweet, and caring. Somehow, I managed to learn better genetics from her than from my lecture. The key thing is to follow her instructions, then you will get an A.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: If you need a gpa booster, TAKE THIS CLASS!! The amount of bonus points I got is insane. I literally finished the class with a 100 and I'm not even a bio major. This professor is also very sweet and superrrr receptive to feedback and concerns. She really wanted to see her students succeed and provided us with all types of resources to help us out.

So many exams there is no point in the fourth exam and final being a week apart but shes not bad for online im sure the workload is less in person, but the textbook is not the best for review just use the lectures and practice questions and youll be fine. lockdown browser and webcam for exams

She is SO NICE. She writes everything on the board so you have a visual even though it's already in the lab procedure, which I loved. I never was confused - she takes everything step by step. She talks everyone through how to write the lab notebook also. As a biology major, this is the first lab I've genuinely looked forward to going to every week.

She is fantastic. She will slow down when you ask and go back to previous concepts when you ask. Get ready to do a lot of writing in your lab notebook. There are pre and post lab quizzes. If you do well on the midterm you don't have to take the final. Highly recommend, but you must show up and not slack off.

Attendance wasn't mandatory. Her accent is very strong, but she's very nice and really good at responding to emails. All quizzes and and tests were online, lockdown browser but no webcam. Lots of group assignments, but all the work was very easy. I rarely went to class and finished with a 98. Lots of extra credit and point opportunities as well.

Weekly quizzes (10~ questions), every other week it'd be a super quiz (50~ questions). 
Take notes during lectures! Open note tests & quizzes- lockdown but no webcam. She gave my course extra credit assignments because people asked for them, and she dropped an assignment because enough people emailed. If you have any issues, just let her know!
Extremely kind and caring professor who clearly cares a lot about her students and their understanding of the topics covered in class. Really enjoyed taking genetics lab with her

I took genetics lab and she was amazing. She's very caring and brings energy to the classroom. Lab is straightforward and the work is simple if you just follow her directions and listen to her. She shows you how to do literally everything and she makes sure you understand the "why" of what you're doing. Easiest A I've gotten

She didn't have a TA to help in the class, so she kind of felt all over the place, but besides that she was clear about her methods and she is clearly very intelligent. Labs are super easy, there is only one or two labs where you have to put in extra work outside of the pre and post-lecture credits.

she's super nice and funny, her class was my fav. she's really chill and just wants students to understand the content. she walked through what we had to do for lab notebooks every class, so its literally impossible to do bad unless your just not paying attention. for presentation/practical she's not tough w/ grading and gives multiple tries.

I literally love her, she's so nice and understanding. We get group quizzes and a super quiz every week plus homework assignments due each week that only take like 10 mins to do. There's no midterm or final!! Everything is really easy to do and her lectures are easy to understand/follow.

Easiest A of my life. No midterm, no final, no in person tests. As long as you do the assignments you'll thrive. She does have a heavy accent which makes lectures hard to understand but she makes up for it with her positive attitude and love for science. If you ask one question, you'll make her day. One of the most chill classes I've had to date.
No final, no in-class test or quizzes, weekly group quizzes that are super easy, you will make good friends!
WILL make you stay until the end of lab. Doesn't let you take the notebook home and you have to do everything in class, and you WILL be rushed.

The lectures are pretty long but she provides a stripped version of her powerpoint lecture with only the necessary info for your exams and HW quizzes. She also provides study guides w/ answers prior to every exam. Respondus w/ cam for exams. Respondus w/ two attempts for Quiz. 8/10 class. Would highly recommend this professor.
super sweet and helpful, wants you to succeed

Absolutely take Prof Simon for biology. She is extremely nice, and gives you every chance to catch-up/review/learn. She provides a LOT of resources. Also, no final! The only thing to consider is that her quizzes and superquizzes (regular quizzes but longer) use lockdown browser.

BEST BIO PROF!! She has an accent, but she's easy to understand. She makes sure everyone understands a topic before moving onto the next one. The quizzes were all done with group members. There are superquizzes, but they're all easy on lockdown with no webcam. She truly cares for her students. This was one of my fav classes all semester. TAKE HER!!

I love Dr. Simon! She is an incredible teacher, is very accessible outside of class and truly cares about her students and what she is teaching! Gives lots of extra credit assignments. I took her Fall Semester of 23', and she was absolutely incredible! I couldn't recommend a better teacher!

Dr. Simon is the best ever! She gives so many extra credit opportunities and even provides one-on-one tutoring. She is an amazing lecturer, please take her if you get the chance!! All assignments are online, quizzes with lockdown browser and throughout the semester you work in groups so it is very convenient with it being a large lecture class.

Professor Bindu is a caring professor. She gives a lot of opportunities and resources to help you pass her class. Tests and quizzes are all online. She also records lectures and book readings. Take her!!!
Literally everything (test, quizzes, hw) are online. Sends out multiple reminder emails about assignments. Gives a lot of help resources and also has sooooo many extra credit opportunities.

Lectures are a little confusing but she takes breaks throughout them. You can choose to work in groups for certain quizzes, and she gives multiple attempts on quizzes. Everything is online, and she gives a lot of extra credit.

I have her for lab and I learned a lot from this course. Seating is important because I worked on group experiments and projects the entire semester so choose wisely. She is super patient and would stop to answer any question. Class materials are fairly easy if follow instructions.
She is super sweet and her lectures were engaging. She has extra credit opportunities and really cared about her students. Great professor! Highly recommend!

I loved this lab! Professor Simon is so sweet and attentive to her students. She will ALWAYS make sure that everyone understands the course content and expectations. Labs were fun and I always looked forward to going :)

I LOVE Dr. Simon. TAKE HER. She is the best and her class was so easy. She asks very straightforward questions on her tests and has bonus questions almost every time. Her test practice questions are very similar to whats on it. Her final also is not cumulative and she offers a retake for one of your tests if you choose to.

She is very lecture based so take good notes, but she also records lectures. Very easy work, tests (or she calls them superquizes) are all online so it's more manageable and convenient. Gives TONSS of extra credit towards the end of the semester, responds to emails quickly. If you can take her DO IT!! Your grade will thank you.

attendance isn't required BUT HIGHLY RECOMMENDED, especially if you need to ask questions. tests are in person and online which is nice. i recommended studying a lot because tests require some extra information from the textbook and you to think a little extra.

Attendance matter due to random learning catalytic, I suggest you to download the powerpoint and review hidden slide, if you are a textbook reader and love to watch lecture recording then congratulation you got the right professor (said from my own experience with this class). Test practice questions will be provide for better understanding.
This class was great. she is very laid back and doesn't have a ton of work. Tests are online! 10/10

She is a little hard to understand at first but she will ask if we understand and if she needs to go over anything. She really wants everyone to succeed and she tries to finish the lab worksheet in class so you don't have to do anything outside of class. She records the class in case you missed something. She makes sure you are prepared for tests.

Dr Simon teaches her class both in person and through zoom, but the experience is the same. Attendance isn't mandatory, but you are split into groups at the beginning of the semester and do group work every week. Can sometimes be a hassle but otherwise this class is an easy A if you know what you're doing.

She is honestly one of the best professors I have ever had. The class work is minimal. There is one quiz every week, which is online. She has a lot of extra credit opportunities and is always ready to help students who need extra help or explanation. She is lively and excited about her job which makes the lectures easy to listen to.

She offers office hours, encourages questions all the time, offers a ton of extra credit opportunities, and also posts her lectures online (& 1 quiz/week). She also takes feedback well - some students said she talked too fast, so she made sure to speak slower in each lecture. Never got special treatment, she's just an amazing and caring professor.

She's a very nice person and a good professor. My only issue is that she sped through the lectures and spoke so fast. However she does have many resources and extra credit. If you do the work you will pass.

Speeds through her lectures and talks very fast, so I stopped attending class. She records the lectures so I always watched them on my own time instead and slowed the speed of the video to understand the topics. Lots of extra credit, she wants you to pass. If you watch the recordings, read the textbook, and do the extra credit, you will do good.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--EXTRA CREDIT--Online Savvy

comment: Simon was an excellent professor. She did talk a bit fast and read through her powerpoints but she always stops to make sure everyone was on the same page. This class was easy A if you took notes and paid attention. Some quizzes were in person but the tests were online with lockdown browser but had no webcam There was also no final exam.

The class is easy. The professor is considerate and understanding. Lectures are interesting. Lots of extra credit opportunities. Homework due every week and quizzes every other week. Overall enjoyable. She also drops lots of grades.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--EXTRA CREDIT--Lots of homework

comment: Such a good professor. One of my easiest classes. She gives you the option of joining a Zoom or attending in person. Only grades were quizzes, super quizzes, and weekly homework. She also gives many opportunities for bonus points, so I was able to end the class with over an 100%. She's super understanding about difficulties and easy to reach.
rating_tags: Caring--Graded by few things--Accessible outside class

comment: Took professor Simon for my genetics lab. She was great. She cares about her students and wants you to succeed. If you do well on the midterm you dont have to take the final. There is a poster at the end, but she makes it easy and straightforward. I ended up with an A. Would definitely take her again.

provides outside materials including uploading recordings of every chapter and hosting a zoom during every classShe did kahoots that counted for attendance but they were completion. Quizzes and superquizzes only no tests and all online. Short online homework due every week. Talks kinda fast and has an accent but not bad if you listen closely.
